intro: Ouratea dependens, commonly known as the hanging ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its drooping inflorescences, which consist of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite and elliptic, often with a slightly waxy texture. Ouratea dependens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique flowering habit.
